speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides the blisters and ulcers?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been experiencing pain in my left cheek when eating and also pain during sexual intercourse. It's been quite uncomfortable.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin or mucous membranes elsewhere on your body, such as in your mouth or genital area?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've noticed ulcers in my mouth and on my gums, as well as some discomfort in the vulvar area. It's been really bothersome.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fever, fatigue, or weight loss recently?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any fever, fatigue, or weight loss. I feel generally okay aside from the discomfort and pain.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections or illnesses, or have you been under significant stress lately?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses, and I wouldn't say I've been under significant stress. Just the usual daily life, really.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any changes in your diet or started any new medications or supplements recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I recently started taking captopril for my hypertension, but I stopped taking meloxicam about two weeks ago. Other than that, my diet has been pretty much the same.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had similar symptoms in the past, or is this the first time you've experienced these issues?

speaker: Patient
text: This is the first time I've experienced these specific symptoms. I've had some joint pain before, but nothing like this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any sensitivity to sunlight or any skin changes after sun exposure?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any sensitivity to sunlight or any changes in my skin after being outside. The blisters appeared without any sun exposure that I can recall.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of autoimmune diseases or skin conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, my family history includes pernicious anemia and Graves' disease, which are both autoimmune conditions.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your vision or any eye discomfort, such as dryness or redness?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any changes in my vision or any discomfort in my eyes. They feel normal to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent dental work or oral procedures that could have triggered these ulcers?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent dental work or oral procedures. The ulcers just appeared on their own without any prior issues.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your nails or hair, such as brittleness or loss?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my nails or hair. They seem to be the same as always.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any joint pain or swelling in your hands, feet, or other areas of your body?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any joint pain or swelling in my hands or feet. My joints feel pretty much the same as they usually do.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or been exposed to any new environments or chemicals that could have triggered these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations, and I haven't been exposed to any new environments or chemicals that I can think of. Just the usual hiking in the woods.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your bowel habits, such as diarrhea or constipation, or any abdominal pain?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in my bowel habits, and I don't have any abdominal pain. Everything seems normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any numbness or tingling in your extremities, or any other neurological symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any numbness or tingling in my extremities, and I don't have any other neurological symptoms. Everything feels normal in that aspect.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to any known allergens or irritants, such as certain foods, plants, or chemicals?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any known exposure to allergens or irritants that I can think of. I’ve been hiking, but I didn’t come into contact with anything I recognized as a potential trigger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your menstrual cycle or any unusual vaginal discharge?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my menstrual cycle, and there hasn't been any unusual vaginal discharge. Everything seems to be normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any oral lesions or sores that have been particularly painful or persistent?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, the ulcers in my mouth have been quite painful, especially when I eat or drink. They've been persistent for the past week.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any swelling or redness around the blisters or ulcers, or any signs of infection?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant swelling or redness around the blisters or ulcers. They seem to be localized without any signs of infection.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms and the absence of signs of infection, I suspect you may have a condition related to an autoimmune response. I would like to confirm this by requesting a biopsy of one of the blisters. REQUEST TEST: Skin_Biopsy

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Acantholysis and intraepidermal blister formation.

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I'm really concerned about these blisters and ulcers. They are causing me a lot of discomfort, and I'm not sure what to expect next. What do you think could be causing these symptoms?
